justification: Package 'a' has Ce = 0 (no outgoing dependencies) and Ca = 0 (no incoming dependencies). The outgoing_dependencies and incoming_dependencies lists are empty, so it does not depend on any other package and therefore cannot depend on a less stable package. Consequently there is no Unstable Dependency smell detected.

com.github.javaparser.printer.concretesyntaxmodel has Ce=7 and Ca=3 → instability I = 7/(7+3) = 0.70. Among its outgoing dependencies, com.github.javaparser.printer.lexicalpreservation has Ce=16 and Ca=3 → I = 16/(16+3) = 0.84, which is more unstable than the analyzed package. Depending on a package with higher instability (0.84 > 0.70) violates the Stable Dependencies Principle and constitutes an unstable dependency. (Other outgoing deps are more stable: com.github.javaparser.utils I≈0.22, com.github.javaparser.ast I≈0.24, com.github.javaparser I≈0.30, com.github.javaparser.printer I≈0.62, com.github.javaparser.ast.comments I≈0.48, com.github.javaparser.ast.observer I≈0.20. Incoming dependents include com.github.javaparser.printer.lexicalpreservation.changes Ce=6 Ca=1 I≈0.86 and com.github.javaparser.printer I≈0.62.)
